text:
Introduction
We have been conducting a comprehensive Headhunting process spanning the global market and we have video interviewed the candidates included in the following shortlist.
The following report provides an overview of our shortlist of candidates. After conducting a full analysis of each candidates’ strengths and weaknesses we now propose the following four candidates to be interviewed by 3V Tech.
Shortlist - UK
Daniel Stockton
John Taylor
Michael Wilson
Robert Galloway
Giuseppe “Gino” Turri

Field Sales Engineer – Rotex Europe Ltd – Cheshire, UK

We have been conducting a comprehensive Headhunting process spanning the global market and we have video interviewed the candidates included in the following shortlist.
The following report provides an overview of our shortlist of candidates. After conducting a full analysis of each candidates’ strengths and weaknesses we now propose the following four candidates to be interviewed by 3V Tech.
Shortlist - UK
Daniel Stockton
John Taylor
Michael Wilson
Robert Galloway
Giuseppe “Gino” Turri
Candidate 1 – Daniel Stockton
Field Sales Engineer – Rotex Europe Ltd – Cheshire, UK
Overview
7 years’ experience working in the Process Equipment and maintenance sector, including mechanical field service support, installation and start-up technical support
Industries worked in include food & beverage, pharmaceutical and chemical markets worldwide
Daniel has strong relevant experience in service, repairs, installation and commissioning of a range of bespoke process and materials handling equipment
Currently working at Rotex who manufacture a range of separation / screening equipment for pharma, food, chemicals sectors and he’s involved in the international Aftermarket team
He travels regularly both in the UK and internationally to the Middle East and Europe
5 years’ service in the Royal Navy as a Marine Engineer, serving on a type 45 destroyer warship, as part of a 25-man strong team of skilled and versatile engineers
Qualifications include NVQ Level 3 in Engineering well as a full apprenticeship in engineering – both attained in the Royal Navy
Our Thoughts
Daniel was interviewed by Daniele during the last process last year and there was positive feedback. At the time he decided to remain with Rotex as the company had offered him a change in his role and he wanted to see how this worked out.
There seems to be some uncertainty in Rotex Europe at the moment, and when we met up with him recently, he expressed his interest in pursuing the opportunity again. Daniel used to work with Christian Niggemeyer (at Rotex) and they have remained in close contact since. Christian has given a positive endorsement of 3V Tech and this has strengthened Daniel’s interest.
We were very impressed with the way Daniel came across during our meeting with him and believe he would be a strong addition to the UK team. He is impressed by 3V’s product range and the company culture – he sees this as a more secure job and one he can learn more in.
Current Salary:  £38,000 base salary
Candidate 2 – John Taylor
Mechanical Maintenance Technician – Lucite International – Stockton on Tees, UK
Overview
Currently a Rotating Equipment Technician at Lucite International which is a Top-Tier COMAH Chemical site – he services the rotating equipment in the production plant including inspections, condition monitoring, installations and commissioning etc.
Previously worked for 12 years at Fine Organics Ltd. another chemicals manufacturer. During this time, he gained proven experience with pressure filters, dryers and reactor systems.
At Fine Organics, he replaced some Pfaudler equipment with 3V Tech on recommendation from Peter Storey (who we understand has worked as a subcontractor for 3V previously)
First-hand experience with equipment from Rosemund (DDPS), Heinkel, Thomas Broadbent, Flowserve and Chemineer
He has NVQ Levels 2 & 3 in Mechanical Engineering Maintenance and an NVQ Level 2 & 3 in Installing Pipe Work Systems
Our Thoughts
John has strong service and maintenance experience and a demonstrable problem-solving ability. He’s based in the North East of England but would be happy in a field-based travelling role across the UK and international. He finds the prospect of international work to be exciting and a change from his one-site focus at this moment.
He is familiar with 3V Tech equipment from his time at Fine Organics and is very interested in moving into a role which offers varied travel and long-term prospects.
Current Salary: Approx. £42k after holidays and deductions

Mechanical Maintenance Technician - Syngenta – Fife, Scotland

Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
